tn.text: This is the name of God that he revealed to his people in the Old Testament. See the translationWord page about Yahweh concerning how to translate this.
AT: "God had sent an ambassador" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"stand up" This phrase is used to tell people to get ready.
AT: "look" or "listen" or "pay attention to what I am about to tell you"
"the people of other nations will hate you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Obadiah's vision concerning Edom continues.
Yahweh uses the part of a person's body that is associated with emotions to refer to the people of Edom feeling pride. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: in the clefts of the rock
tn.text: "in the cracks in the rock"
"in your home that was built in a high place"

tn.ref: Who will bring me down to the ground?
tn.text: This question is showing how the Edomites were proud and felt safe. AT: "I am safe from all attackers." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Though you soar high like the eagle and though your nest is set among the stars
tn.text: Both of these phrases are saying Edom is built much higher than possible, to say it was built in a very high place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: I will bring you down from there
tn.text: Pride is associated with height and humility is associated with being low. Yahweh says he will bring Edom down to say he will humble it. AT: "I will humble you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Yahweh continues giving Obadiah his message to Edom.
"or if robbers came during the night"
people who steal things by being violent to other people
Yahweh adds this phrase in the middle of another sentence to express that the punishment of Edom is shocking. AT: "ah, you are completely destroyed." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: would they not only steal enough for themselves?
tn.text: AT: "They would only steal enough for themselves." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: How Esau has been ransacked, and his hidden treasures sought out
tn.text: AT: "Ah, enemies have searched Esau; they have looked for his hidden treasure." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
searching for things in order to steal them
Yahweh continues giving Obadiah his message to Edom.
The word "your" refers to the nation of Edom.

tn.ref: will send you on your way to the border
tn.text: "will send you out of their land." The people of Edom will try to take refuge in the land of their allies, but their allies will not let the people of Edom stay in their land.

tn.ref: There is no understanding in him
tn.text: "Edom cannot understand."

tn.ref: Will I not on that day," says Yahweh, "destroy ... mountain of Esau?
tn.text: "'On that day,' says Yahweh, 'I surely will destroy ... mountain of Esau." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Your mighty men will be dismayed
tn.text: "Your strong warriors will be afraid"
the name of a region in the land of Edom. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: so that every man may be cut off from the mountain of Esau by slaughter
tn.text: AT: "so that there will be no more people in the mountains of Esau because enemies killed them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Most of the land of Esau was mountains, so this is one way of referring to the land of Esau.
Yahweh continues giving Obadiah his message to Edom.
AT: "your relatives who are the descendants of Jacob." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: you will be covered with shame
tn.text: "you will be completely ashamed"
"will never exist again." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"watched and did nothing to help"
people from other nations
The word "his" refers to "Jacob," which is another way of referring to the people of Israel.
This phrase means "they cast lots to decide who would get the valuable things that they took from Jerusalem." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: you were like one of them
tn.text: "it was as though you were one of these strangers and foreigners"
Yahweh continues giving Obadiah his message to Edom.
"do not be happy because of" or "do not take pleasure in"
This was a way of referring to the people of Israel because Jacob and Esau were brothers.
AT: "day of punishment" or "time of punishment." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"disaster" or "trouble"

tn.ref: in the day of their destruction
tn.text: "in the day that their enemies destroy them"

tn.ref: in the day of their distress
tn.text: "because of the time that they are suffering"
These are all different translations of the same word. Translators should use one word to translate all three of these.
"because of the bad things that happen to them"
"do not take their wealth" "or "do not steal their wealth"
a place where two roads come together
"to kill the people of Israel who are trying to escape" or "to catch those who were trying to escape" (UDB)

tn.ref: do not hand over his survivors
tn.text: "do not capture those who are still alive and give them to their enemies"
Yahweh continues giving Obadiah his message to Edom.

tn.ref: For the day of Yahweh is near upon all the nations
tn.text: "Soon the time will come when Yahweh will show all the nations that he is Lord."

tn.ref: As you have done, it will be done to you
tn.text: "I will do to you the same things that you did to others." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: your deeds will return on your own head
tn.text: AT: "you will suffer the consequences for the things you have done." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The word "you" to the people of Edom.
The prophets describe people whom Yahweh punished as drinking the punishment from Yahweh AT: "as I have punished you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This was a way of referring to Jerusalem.

tn.ref: will all the nations drink continually
tn.text: AT: "I will punish all of the nations without stopping." Yahweh punished Jerusalem, but he stopped before he destroyed all of the people. However, he will punish the rest of the nations until they no longer exist.
Yahweh continues giving Obadiah his message.
"escape the punishment of Yahweh." These are the people that are still alive after Yahweh has punished. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The word "it" refers to "mount Zion."

tn.ref: house of Jacob ... Joseph a flame
tn.text: Yahweh compares the houses of Jacob and Joseph to fire because they will destroy Esau like a fire that quickly and completely burns up straw. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"straw" or "chaff." The dry pieces of plant that are left after grain is harvested.
The word "they" refers to the house of Jacob and the house of Joseph.
The word "them" refers to the descendants of Esau, who are the nation of Edom.

tn.ref: There will be no survivors to the house of Esau
tn.text: "Not one person of the house of Esau will survive"
"the tribe of Benjamin" or "the people of Benjamin"

tn.ref: The exiles of this host of the people of Israel
tn.text: "Those of the host of the people of Israel who were in exile"
a very large group of people
This is the name of a Phoenician city on the coast of the Mediterranean between Tyre and Sidon. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a place whose location is unknown. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This refers to various Israelite military leaders whom God will use to defeat the nation of Edom.
